svcproc.title: Camshaft Position (CMP) Sensor
svcproc.para: The CMP sensor, a magnetic pickup sensor, indicates camshaft speed and position.

The CMP sensor sends a pulsed signal to the ECM when a single peg on the camshaft rotates past the CMP sensor once during each revolution of the camshaft. The ECM calculates camshaft speed and position from CMP signal frequency.
The CMP sensor is installed in the front cover, to the right of the water pump pulley.

note.para: The short CMP sensor, used with International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9, and 10 diesel engines, is the Crankshaft Position (CKP) sensor used with other International® diesel engines.
